metadata.title: CVE-2018-14648 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in 389 Directory Server. A specially crafted search querycould lead to excessive CPU consumption in the do_search() function. Anunauthenticated attacker could use this flaw to provoke a denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.0.18-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.0.18-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.0.18-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.0.18-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.0.18-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.0.18-1').
